result.execSummary:
The defendant Jarques T. Jackson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property >$5000-$10,000, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

miscConds.notes: Eligible for expungment upon successfull completion of probation.

No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs.
Complete high school degree.
Write letter of apology to the victims this meaningful and sincere and is approved by the Agent.
DNA sample.

No contact with Bridgette Parnell.
No sexual contact at all with girlfriend Emily  and cannot be with Emily with any supervision.

timeConds.notes: ALL BUT 15 DAYS IS STAYED WITH NO GOOD TIME ALLOWED.
45 days is stayed. Release date to be Monday 11/28/2016 so he can go to school.

records.addlTxt: 09:58 Defendant Jarques T. Jackson in court, in custody. Agent Drazkowski in court.  Agent requesting 60 days conditional jail with no contact conditions via court order. Court orders no contact with Bridgette Parnell, no sexual contact at all with any human being under age 18, and no sexual relations with girlfriend Emily and cannot be with Emily without any supervision. Defendant has been in custody since 11/13/16, court orders 60 days conditional jail, court stays all but time served since 11/13/16, 45 days stayed.  Defendant to be released on Monday 11/28/2016 so that he can go to school.
from DOC Agent S Drazkowski re: violations and asking for 60 days conditional jail time, No contact provision, AODA and huber to attend school.
Probation review hearing on November 23, 2016 at 09:45 am.
Defendant's JOC re: Return to Sender. Not Deliverable as addressed.

11:10   Defendant Jarques T. Jackson in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   PSI has been reviewed and no corrections.  State will adopt the recomendation. 13113.92 restitution is requested jt and sev with co-defendants. Probation for 2 years. Cond jail of 30 days. Apology to the defendants  ATty Kemp addresses the sentence. Requests 90 days imposed and stayed.  Court orders S/ W Probation 3 years.  Conditions: Costs, Restitution $13,113.92 Jt and sev with co defendants, 90 days conditional jail time all but 15 days is stayed with no good time.  Huber is allowed. The rules of probation are complete high school degree   No consumption of alcohol or illegal drugs allowed. May only have the prescribed amount of prescription drugs. Pay supervision fees, Write letter of apology to the victims that is meaningfull and sincere and is approved by the agent.  DNA and surcharge. No time  allowed.  Jail sentence to start immediately. Expungment is granted if successfully completes.
copy emailed to both Atty Froelich and Kemp
copy emailed to both Atty Froelich and Kemp
from Agent Drazkowski stating she will be on vacation but Agent Minder will be available for sentencing.
Sentencing hearing on July 5, 2016 at 10:30 am.

03:38 16CF2 also heard at this time Defendant Jarques T. Jackson in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Froelich:  Files amended information, theft moveable property, for 15CF268, requesting PSI, restitution joint and several and apology letter from defendant, dismiss 16CF2.  Attorney Kemp and and defendant agree.    Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.   Constitutional rights explained to defendant.   Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights.    DEF PLEADS GUILTY to count 1 of the amended information in 15CF268.   Facts are correct.   COURT ACCEPTS PLEA, FINDS DEF FREELY, INTELLIGENTLY, KNOWINGLY & UNDERSTANDINGLY MADE AND WAIVES CONSTITUTIONAL RIGHTS.  The court finds the defendant guilty and adjudicates defendant guilty of count 1 of amended information in 15CF268.  Court dismisses charges in 16CF2 and orders a PSI for 15CF268.  Parties to see JA for sentencing date 60 days out.  Defendant to remain until he is handed a notice.  Court reviews bond conditions with the defendant.  03:47
and restitution Information and Affidavit of Claim: Mark A Mattison, Amy Marie Johnson, B.M.J.

02:33 16CF2 also heard at this time. Defendant Jarques Tyquan Jackson in court with attorney Jeffrey Lawrence Kemp.  Sean Edward Froelich appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Tara Wentlandt is sworn in.  Froelich examines Deputy Wentlandt.  Kemp x-examines Deputy Wentlandt. State calls Investigator Koch, Inv. Koch is sworn in. Froelich examines Investigator Koch.   Investigator Koch identifies the Defendant. Kemp x-examines Inv. Koch. State requests Defendant be binded over.    The court finds probable cause and binds defendant over for further proceedings.

3:48 Defendant Jarques Tyquan Jackson in court  VIA VIDEO CONFERENCING FROM PCJ, in custody.  Rory Eoin O'Sullivan appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty Liesl Nelson appeared in court via phone.  Defendant has copy of complaint.  Court reads charges and possible penalties.  Defendant waives reading of the complaint.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  Exam'd re: understanding of law, penalty and rights. OSullivan: $3000 signature bond with no contact. Nelson has no objection.
